items.label: Building and Testing Beaver Notes
items.docId: dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Building and Testing Beaver Notes

dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Building and Testi.id: dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Building and Testing Beaver Notes
dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Building and Testi.title: Building and Testing Beaver Notes
dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Building and Testi.description: Now that you have your development environment ready, let's move on to building and testing Beaver Notes.

dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Data API.title: Data API
dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Data API.description: The data api is designed for third party applications to be able to interact with Beaver Notes by creating notes, labels and deleting notes.

dev-docs/Beaver Notes/How to contribure.title: How to contribure
dev-docs/Beaver Notes/How to contribure.description: Welcome to the Beaver Notes community! We appreciate your interest in contributing to our privacy-focused note-taking app.

dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Legacy Localizatio.title: Legacy Localization
dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Legacy Localizatio.description: At Beaver, we believe in creating software that is both privacy-friendly and accessible to everyone, and you can assist us in achieving this by translating Beaver into your own language.

dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Localization.title: Localization
dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Localization.description: Localizing is crucial to ensure that Beaver is accessible to a wider audience. Instead of depending solely on an internal translation team, we invite your participation, enabling anyone to submit translations effortlessly, even without technical expertise. To facilitate the onboarding of new translators, we've crafted this translation guide.

dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Packaging the app.title: Packaging the app
dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Packaging the app.description: This page is intended for individuals who wish to redistribute or package Beaver for package managers and platforms not yet supported. It is not intended for packaging releases of the app its

dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Setup Your Environ.title: Setup Your Environment
dev-docs/Beaver Notes/Setup Your Environ.description: Dive into contributing by setting up your local development environment. Follow these steps to clone the Beaver Notes repository and get ready for action.

user-docs/Beaver Notes/Getting Around.title: Getting Around
user-docs/Beaver Notes/Getting Around.description: This section will introduce you to the app's user interface and navigation, helping you get familiar with all the essential elements to make the most of your note-taking experience.

user-docs/Beaver Notes/Install.title: Install
user-docs/Beaver Notes/Install.description: To get started with Beaver Notes, visit the website at beavernotes.com and navigate to the download section. Choose the installer that matches your operating system â€“ whether it's macOS, Windows, or a Linux distribution. Once you've selected the right installer, you can either go on and follow on-screen instructions or keep reading this section of the docs for better guidance.

user-docs/Beaver Notes/Labels.title: Labels
user-docs/Beaver Notes/Labels.description: Labels are quite easy to master and can quickly become your best friends as they help you find and organize your notes,thoughts, and more.

user-docs/Beaver Notes/Markdown syntax.title: Markdown syntax
user-docs/Beaver Notes/Markdown syntax.description: Markdown is a powerful language that helps you get things

user-docs/Beaver Notes/Password.title: Password
user-docs/Beaver Notes/Password.description: On this page, you'll be guided through securing your notes and resetting the password.

user-docs/Beaver Notes/Set up the Sync.title: Set up the Sync
user-docs/Beaver Notes/Set up the Sync.description: With version 0.0.7, Beaver Notes now enables you to sync data between your devices by simply selecting a path and clicking a button when needed.
